Support include strengthening whole of government approach to migration management. National Coordination Mechanism on Migration is an inter-ministerial whole of government structure consisting of more than 18 agencies at national level. At the border level, the integrated border management committee (IBMC) will be provided with technical support as well.
projects.outcome: Output 1.2. The Government of South Sudan is better equipped to undertake judicial and security sector reforms, complete DDR processes, and deliver transitional justice in full compliance with the R-A

projects.name: "Strengthened data systems and evidence for sexual and reproductive health and rights, gender-based violence and population changes"
projects.description:
The elements of the sub-output are continuing from previous CF are: 
1.	Support to Health and GBV IMS and Civil Registration system.  
2.	Capacity Building for MDAs in data management. 
3.	Population Estimation Survey (Dissemination) and thematic reports. 
4.	Surveys and studies - GBV Survey and Demographic Dividend analysis
5.	Preparations for National Population and Housing Census; and support to SDG monitoring.

projects.name: Strengthening the capacity of government and communities in South Sudan to adapt to climate change
projects.description: The proposed LDCF project will focus on the priority areas identified within South Sudan’s National Adaptation Programme of Action (NAPA), namely agriculture, disaster risk reduction, environment, water resources, policy and institutional frameworks. The primary objective of the project is to increase the resilience of vulnerable communities in two states in South Sudan to the observed and predicted impacts of climate change. projects.name: Addressing Illegal Killing and Disturbance of Sahelo-Saharan Megafauna
projects.description: The  project  is  a  four-year  regional  project  to  strengthen  conservation  efforts  for  the  Sahelo-Saharan  Megafauna,  with national activities to save the Addax in Niger. A total of 16 Sahelo-Saharan Megafauna Range States will be engaged in the project (Algeria, Burkina Faso, Chad, Egypt, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Libya, Mali, Mauritania, Morocco, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, South Sudan,  Sudan  and  Tunisia).
